main event: Multiple witnesses, including nurses and U.S. Army personnel, reported seeing strange lights in the sky on various dates in November 1963.
interesting points: The lights were described as red and white, moving slowly and erratically across the sky., The sightings were reported by local nurses and a U.S. Army officer., Some witnesses believed the lights could be helicopters, but they noted they were unlike any known aircraft., One witness described an object as being fiery and fluctuating in size as it approached., The sightings prompted reports to the Michigan State Police and the Office of Special Investigations at Selfridge Air Force Base.
witness description: nurses from the Center, a U.S. Army officer, and local civilians
